title: Understanding Telecom Language Through Large Language Models. (arXiv:2306.07933v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: The recent progress of artificial intelligence (AI) opens up new frontiers in the possibility of automating many tasks involved in Telecom networks design, implementation, and deployment. This has been further pushed forward with the evolution of generative artificial intelligence (AI), including the emergence of large language models (LLMs), which is believed to be the cornerstone toward realizing self-governed, interactive AI agents. Motivated by this, in this paper, we aim to adapt the paradigm of LLMs to the Telecom domain. In particular, we fine-tune several LLMs including BERT, distilled BERT, RoBERTa and GPT-2, to the Telecom domain languages, and demonstrate a use case for identifying the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) standard working groups. translated_title: 通过大语言模型理解电信语言
translated_abstract: 人工智能的最新进展为自动化电信网络的许多任务提供了新的可能性。由于出现了包括大型语言模型在内的生成式人工智能，这一进展进一步推动了这一可能性的实现，这被认为是实现自我治理和互动式人工智能代理的基石。本文旨在将LLMs的范例应用于电信领域，具体而言，我们将fine-tune几个LLMs，包括BERT、Distilled BERT、RoBERTa和GPT-2，以适应电信领域的语言，并演示用例来识别第三代合作伙伴项目（3GPP）标准工作组。
tldr: 文章提出通过fine-tune多个大型语言模型实现电信领域自动化操作，以便识别3GPP标准工作组。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes using fine-tuned large language models such as BERT, RoBERTa, distilled BERT and GPT-2 to automate tasks and identify the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) standard working groups in the telecommunications domain.
